disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of right lower limb, including hip

symptoms.name: Hard, ulcerative mass
symptoms.pattern: Irregular border, yellowish slough in the base, blood oozing

symptoms.name: Sore or scab
symptoms.pattern: Present for about two months or more

physical_findings: Hard ulcerative mass of 5x4 cm in the right inguinal region along the crease
Multiple hard enlargements of inguinal lymph nodes
risk_factors: Long duration of the primary lesion

imaging_findings.PET/CT scan: Diffuse metastasis, right inguinal mass (SUV max 9.6, 6.5x2.8 cm), diffuse bone metastasis in the left proximal femur (SUV max 11.5), bilateral iliac, sacrum, vertebral bodies, right scapula, right upper ribs, and right anterior pulmonary nodule (0.5x0.5 cm, SUV max 4.7). No abnormal uptake in the brain. US liver and biliary normal.

required: Histological confirmation of squamous cell carcinoma
supportive: Clinical presentation (ulcerative mass, enlarged lymph nodes)
